geometricus package¶

Submodules¶

geometricus.geometricus module¶

geometricus.geometricus.Shapemer = typing.Tuple[int, int, int, int]¶

A tuple of four integers, each derived from one of the four moments

geometricus.geometricus.Shapemers = typing.List[typing.Tuple[int, int, int, int]]¶

A list of Shapemer types

class geometricus.geometricus.SplitType[source]¶

Bases: enum.IntEnum

Different approaches to structural fragmentation

KMER = 1¶

each residue is taken as the center of a kmer of length split_size, ends are included but shorter

RADIUS = 2¶

overlapping spheres of radius split_size

RADIUS_UPSAMPLE = 3¶

overlapping spheres of radius split_size on coordinates upsampled by upsample rate. Only works if there’s one atom selected per residue

ALLMER = 4¶

adds kmers of different lengths (split_size - 5 to split_size + 5) to take into account deletions/insertions that don’t change the shape

KMER_CUT = 5¶

same as kmer but ends are not included, only fragments of length split_size are kept

class geometricus.geometricus.GeometricusEmbedding(invariants: Dict[ProteinKey, 'MomentInvariants'], resolution: Union[float, np.ndarray], protein_keys: List[ProteinKey], shapemer_keys: Shapemers, embedding: np.ndarray, shapemer_to_protein_indices: Dict[Shapemer, List[Tuple[ProteinKey, int]]], proteins_to_shapemers: Dict[ProteinKey, Shapemers])[source]¶

Bases: object

Class for storing embedding information

invariants: Dict[ProteinKey, 'MomentInvariants'] = None¶

Dictionary mapping protein_keys to MomentInvariant objects

resolution: Union[float, np.ndarray] = None¶

Multiplier that determines how coarse/fine-grained each shape is. This can be a single number, multiplied to all four moment invariants or a numpy array of four numbers, one for each invariant

protein_keys: List[ProteinKey] = None¶

List of protein names = rows of the output embedding

shapemer_keys: Shapemers = None¶

If given uses only these shapemers for the embedding. If None, uses all shapemers

embedding: np.ndarray = None¶

Embedding matrix of size (len(protein_keys), len(self.shapemer_keys))

shapemer_to_protein_indices: Dict[Shapemer, List[Tuple[ProteinKey, int]]] = None¶

Maps each shapemer to the proteins which have it and to the corresponding residue indices within these proteins

proteins_to_shapemers: Dict[ProteinKey, Shapemers] = None¶

Maps each protein to a list of shapemers in order of its residues

classmethod from_invariants(invariants: Union[Generator['MomentInvariants'], List['MomentInvariants']], resolution: Union[float, np.ndarray] = 1.0, protein_keys: Union[None, List[ProteinKey]] = None, shapemer_keys: Union[None, List[Shapemer]] = None)[source]¶

Make a GeometricusEmbedding object from a list of MomentInvariant objects

Parameters

  • invariants – List of MomentInvariant objects

  • resolution – multiplier that determines how coarse/fine-grained each shape is this can be a single number, multiplied to all four moment invariants or a numpy array of four numbers, one for each invariant

  • protein_keys – list of protein names = rows of the output embedding. if None, takes all keys in invariants

  • shapemer_keys – if given uses only these shapemers for the embedding. if None, uses all shapemers

embed(invariants: Union[Generator['MomentInvariants'], List['MomentInvariants']], protein_keys: Union[None, List[ProteinKey]] = None) → 'GeometricusEmbedding'[source]¶

Embed a new set of proteins using an existing embedding’s shapemers

Parameters

  • invariants – List of MomentInvariant objects.

  • protein_keys – list of protein names = rows of the output embedding

Returns

Return type

a GeometricusEmbedding object on the new (test) keys

map_shapemer_to_residues(shapemer: Tuple[int, int, int, int]) → Dict[Union[str, Tuple[str, str]], Set[int]][source]¶

Gets residues within a particular shapemer across all proteins.

class geometricus.geometricus.MomentInvariants(name: ProteinKey, length: int, coordinates: np.ndarray, residue_splits: List[List[int]], original_indices: np.ndarray, sequence: str = typing.Union[str, NoneType], split_type: SplitType = <SplitType.KMER: 1>, split_size: int = 16, upsample_rate: int = 50, split_indices: Union[List, None] = None, moments: np.ndarray = None)[source]¶

Bases: geometricus.protein_utility.Structure

Class for storing moment invariants for a protein. Use from_* constructors to make an instance of this. Subclasses Structure so also has name, length, and coordinates attributes.

residue_splits: List[List[int]] = None¶

split a protein into residues using these atom indices, e.g [[1, 2], [3, 4]] could represent both alpha and beta carbons being used in a residue. Right now only the alpha carbons are used so this contains indices of alpha carbons for each residue if prody is used or just indices in a range if coordinates are given directly

original_indices: np.ndarray = None¶

Also alpha indices (if prody) / range (if coordinates)

sequence: str = typing.Union[str, NoneType]¶

Amino acid sequence

split_type: SplitType = 1¶

How to fragment structure, see SplitType’s documentation for options

split_size: int = 16¶

kmer size or radius (depending on split_type)

upsample_rate: int = 50¶

ignored unless split_type = “radius_upsample

split_indices: Union[List, None] = None¶

Filled with a list of residue indices for each structural fragment

moments: np.ndarray = None¶

Filled with moment invariant values for each structural fragment

classmethod from_coordinates(name: Union[str, Tuple[str, str]], coordinates: numpy.ndarray, sequence: Optional[str] = None, split_type: geometricus.geometricus.SplitType = <SplitType.KMER: 1>, split_size: int = 16, upsample_rate: int = 50)[source]¶

Construct MomentInvariants instance from a set of coordinates. Assumes one coordinate per residue.

classmethod from_prody_atomgroup(name: Union[str, Tuple[str, str]], protein: prody.atomic.atomgroup.AtomGroup, split_type: geometricus.geometricus.SplitType = <SplitType.KMER: 1>, split_size: int = 16, selection: str = 'calpha', upsample_rate: int = 50)[source]¶

Construct MomentInvariants instance from a ProDy AtomGroup object. Selects according to selection string, (default = alpha carbons)

Example

>>> invariants = MomentInvariants.from_prody_atomgroup(atom_group, split_type=SplitType.RADIUS)
classmethod from_pdb_file(pdb_file: Union[str, pathlib.Path], chain: Optional[str] = None, split_type: geometricus.geometricus.SplitType = <SplitType.KMER: 1>, split_size: int = 16, selection: str = 'calpha', upsample_rate: int = 50)[source]¶

Construct MomentInvariants instance from a PDB file and optional chain. Selects according to selection string, (default = alpha carbons)

Example

>>> invariants = MomentInvariants.from_pdb_file("5EAU.pdb", chain="A", split_type=SplitType.RADIUS)
classmethod from_pdb_id(pdb_name: str, chain: Optional[str] = None, split_type: geometricus.geometricus.SplitType = <SplitType.KMER: 1>, split_size: int = 16, selection: str = 'calpha', upsample_rate: int = 50)[source]¶

Construct MomentInvariants instance from a PDB ID and optional chain (downloads the PDB file from RCSB). Selects according to selection string, (default = alpha carbons)

Example

>>> invariants = MomentInvariants.from_pdb_id("5EAU", chain="A", split_type=SplitType.RADIUS)
geometricus.geometricus.get_shapes(invariants: Dict[Union[str, Tuple[str, str]], geometricus.geometricus.MomentInvariants], resolution: Union[float, numpy.ndarray] = 2.0) → Dict[Union[str, Tuple[str, str]], List[Tuple[int, int, int, int]]][source]¶

moment invariants -> log transformation -> multiply by resolution -> floor = shapemers

geometricus.protein_utility module¶

geometricus.protein_utility.ProteinKey = typing.Union[str, typing.Tuple[str, str]]¶

A protein key is either its PDB ID (str) or a tuple of (PDB ID, chain)

geometricus.protein_utility.get_beta_indices(protein: prody.atomic.atomgroup.AtomGroup) → List[int][source]¶

Get indices of beta carbons of pd AtomGroup object (If beta carbon doesn’t exist, alpha carbon index is returned)
